Behaviours
Price scaling
All elements in the Price component scale in proportion to the
font-size of the integer. For the Mixed size Price styling; the
decimals, currency symbols and subscript are sized at 50% the
font-size of the integer.

Price wrapping
- Containerwidth ——M Prices expand horizontally. When the component is constrained
by the width of its container, the text elements in Price will start
to wrap to new lines. Digits can wrap per character. Words in the
subscript wrap by word.
Examples here are for edge cases where the Price component
has both a lot of characters and a subscript.
Baseline and superscript
Several alignment options are available for the decimal value and
y 0 0 € currency symbol. This is because some markets have different
requirements on how the decimal value and the currency symbol
should be displayed. Some markets require both the decimal
value and the currency symbol to be set to the baseline, while
others require just the currency symbol to be set to the baseline
0 0 with the decimal value remaining superscript.

Negative price
Negative prices are often used to express discounts applied
during checkout or refunds, using the Fixed size Price variant. We
use the Unicode "minus sign" (U+2212), followed by a Unicode
"thin space" (U+2009) in order to enable screen readers to read
the negative price properly.
—00,00€
I
Adding extra space
When extra space between the currency symbol and price is
required, the optional 'Currency Spacing’ property should be set.
It uses the "thin space" unicode (U+2009).
Sizing prices
Size prices prominently and proudly. Larger prices form a critical brand identifier for
IKEA. They are the largest element on the product display next to the image of the
product itself.
The font sizes listed under our Price Scale refer to the integer's font size, when Mixed
size variant is used the general rule is that the decimal and the currency sign
are sized at 50% the font size of the integer. (Starting from price-size-500 (24px). Prices
smaller than 24px are always the Fixed size variant.)
Implementation
Prices are, at minimum, double in size of the product name. In areas where it can be
impactful making the price larger than this minimum is encouraged.
Exceptions
In certain cases when lack of screen estate is critical, prices are at minimum the same
size of the product name.

information is portrayed in a purely visual way. For example,
when two prices are presented and one is struck out, screen
reader specific text is required to differentiate the previous price
